title: 5 Things to Catch
body_text:
1. An early gridiron showdown
Kasson-Mantorville and Stewartville met for the Section 1, Class 4A football championship a year ago. They won't get that chance this season, as Stewartville has moved into Class 3A. But the long-time rivals will still meet on the gridiron this fall. That matchup is set for 7 p.m. Friday at Stewartville. We'll preview the game Thursday and have full coverage on Friday night.
ADVERTISEMENT
2. Filling the force
In the wake of the end of the Goodhue Police Department, how are other law enforcement agencies faring when it comes to filling positions? Reporter Brian Todd will help answer that question in the Tuesday edition of the Post Bulletin.
3. Questions anyone?
The Rochester Chamber of Commerce, League of Women Voters and VFW plan to host events, as city staff offers to speak to community groups about the upcoming sales tax vote. Check out the Post Bulletin next week for more.
4. A focus on volleyball
It's just a couple of days into September, but some rivalry matches have already taken place in southeastern Minnesota high school volleyball. PB sports reporter Pat Ruff will take a look at those, as well as some of the top performances so far in the young season, in the first High School Volleyball Focus of the season. That can be found at PostBulletin.com/Sports on Friday.
5. Little white church
ADVERTISEMENT
Here's the church; there is its steeple. Now let's raise funds to save it from all the people. Check out a story about the little white church on Highway 63 in South Troy in the Tuesday edition.
